text: Charles Fried (April 15, 1935 - January 23, 2024) was a Czech-born American jurist and lawyer of Jewish descent. He served as United States Solicitor General under President Ronald Reagan from 1985 to 1989. He was a professor at Harvard Law School and was a visiting professor at Columbia Law School. Fried was the author of nine books and over 30 journal articles, and his work appeared in over a dozen collections.
